/Users/trevorw/projects/tke-code/lib/plugins.tcl

00001 # Name:    plugins.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/11/2013
00004 # Brief:   Namespace to support the plugin framework.
00005 #
00006 # List of available plugin actions:
00007 #  menu         - Adds a menu to the main menubar
00008 #  tab_popup    - Adds items to the tab popup menu
00009 #  root_popup   - Adds items to a root directory sidebar popup menu
00010 #  dir_popup    - Adds items to a non-root directory sidebar popup menu
00011 #  file_popup   - Adds items to a file sidebar popup menu
00012 #  text_binding - Adds one or more bindings to a created text field.
00013 #  on_start     - Runs when the editor is started or when the plugin is installed
00014 #  on_open      - Runs when a tab is opened
00015 #  on_focusin   - Runs when a tab receives focus
00016 #  on_close     - Runs when a tab is closed
00017 #  on_quit      - Runs when the editor is exited
00018 #  on_reload    - Takes action when the plugin is reloaded
00019 #  on_save      - Runs prior to a file being saved
00020 #  on_uninstall - Runs when the plugin is uninstalled by the user.  Allows UI cleanup, etc.
00021 
00022 namespace eval plugins {
00023 
00024   variable registry_size 0
00025   variable plugin_mb     ""
00026   variable tab_popup     ""
00027   variable root_popup    ""
00028   variable dir_popup     ""
00029   variable file_popup    ""
00030 
00031   array set registry     {}
00032   array set plugins      {}
00033   array set prev_sourced {}
00034   array set bound_tags   {}
00035 
00036   ######################################################################
00037   # Procedure that is called be each plugin that registers all of the
00038   # actions that the plugin can perform.
00039   proc register {name actions} {
00040 
00041     variable registry
00042     variable registry_size
00043 
00044     set i 0
00045     while {($i < $registry_size) && ($registry($i,name) ne $name)} {
00046       incr i
00047     }
00048 
00049     if {$i < $registry_size} {
00050       set j 0
00051       foreach action $actions {
00052         set registry($i,action,[lindex $action 0],$j) [lrange $action 1 end]
00053         incr j
00054       }
00055     }
00056 
00057   }
00058 
00059   ######################################################################
00060   # Loads the header information from all available plugins.
00061   proc load {{read_config_file 1}} {
00062 
00063     variable registry
00064     variable registry_size
00065 
00066     set registry_size 0
00067 
00068     foreach plugin [glob -nocomplain -directory [file join $::tke_dir plugins] -types d *] {
00069 
00070       # Read the header information
00071       if {![catch { tkedat::read [file join $plugin header.tkedat] 0 } rc]} {
00072 
00073         array set header $rc
00074 
00075         # Store this information if the name is specified and it should be included
00076         if {[info exists header(name)] && ($header(name) ne "") && [info exists header(include)] && ($header(include) eq "yes")} {
00077           set registry($registry_size,selected)    0
00078           set registry($registry_size,status)      ""
00079           set registry($registry_size,interp)      ""
00080           set registry($registry_size,tgntd)       0
00081           set registry($registry_size,file)        [file join $plugin main.tcl]
00082           set registry($registry_size,name)        $header(name)
00083           set registry($registry_size,author)      [expr {[info exists header(author)]         ? $header(author)         : ""}]
00084           set registry($registry_size,email)       [expr {[info exists header(email)]          ? $header(email)          : ""}]
00085           set registry($registry_size,version)     [expr {[info exists header(version)]        ? $header(version)        : ""}]
00086           set registry($registry_size,description) [expr {[info exists header(description)]    ? $header(description)    : ""}]
00087           set registry($registry_size,treqd)       [expr {[info exists header(trust_required)] ? ([string compare -nocase $header(trust_required) "yes"] == 0) : 0}]
00088           incr registry_size
00089         }
00090 
00091       }
00092 
00093     }
00094 
00095     # Read in the contents of the plugin configuration file
00096     if {$read_config_file} {
00097       read_config
00098     }
00099 
00100   }
00101 
00102   ######################################################################
00103   # Perfoms a reload of the available plugins.
00104   proc reload {} {
00105 
00106     variable registry
00107     variable registry_size
00108     variable prev_sourced
00109 
00110     # Delete all plugin menu items
00111     delete_all_menus
00112 
00113     # Delete all plugin text bindings
00114     delete_all_text_bindings
00115 
00116     catch { array unset prev_sourced }
00117     for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00118       if {$registry($i,selected) && ($registry($i,interp) ne "")} {
00119         foreach action [array names registry $i,action,on_reload,*] {
00120           set prev_sourced($registry($i,name)) $registry($action)
00121         }
00122         handle_resourcing $i
00123         interpreter::destroy $registry($i,name)
00124         set registry($i,interp) ""
00125       }
00126     }
00127 
00128     # Clear the plugin information
00129     array unset registry
00130     set registry_size 0
00131 
00132     # Load plugin header information
00133     load
00134 
00135     # Add all of the plugins
00136     add_all_menus
00137 
00138     # Add all of the text bindings
00139     add_all_text_bindings
00140 
00141     # Tell the user that the plugins have been successfully reloaded
00142     gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Plugins successfully reloaded"]
00143 
00144   }
00145 
00146   ######################################################################
00147   # Writes the current plugin configuration file to the tke home directory.
00148   proc write_config {} {
00149 
00150     variable registry
00151     variable registry_size
00152     variable plugins
00153 
00154     # Create the array to store in the plugins.tkedat file
00155     for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00156       set plugins($registry($i,name)) [list selected $registry($i,selected) trust_granted $registry($i,tgntd)]
00157     }
00158 
00159     # Store the data
00160     catch { tkedat::write [file join $::tke_home plugins.tkedat] [array get plugins] }
00161 
00162   }
00163 
00164   ######################################################################
00165   # Reads the user's plugin configuration file.
00166   proc read_config {} {
00167 
00168     variable registry
00169     variable registry_size
00170     variable plugins
00171     variable prev_sourced
00172 
00173     set bad_sources [list]
00174 
00175     # Read the plugins file
00176     if {![catch { tkedat::read [file join $::tke_home plugins.tkedat] } rc]} {
00177 
00178       array set plugins $rc
00179 
00180       for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00181         if {[info exists plugins($registry($i,name))]} {
00182           array set data $plugins($registry($i,name))
00183           if {$data(selected) || [info exists prev_sourced($registry($i,name))]} {
00184             set registry($i,selected) 1
00185             set registry($i,tgntd)    $data(trust_granted)
00186             set interpreter [interpreter::create $registry($i,name) $data(trust_granted)]
00187             if {[catch "interp eval $interpreter source $registry($i,file)" status]} {
00188               handle_status_error $i $status
00189               lappend bad_sources $i
00190               interpreter::destroy $registry($i,name)
00191             } else {
00192               set registry($i,interp) $interpreter
00193               handle_reloading $i
00194               # add_all_text_bindings
00195             }
00196           }
00197         }
00198 
00199       }
00200 
00201     }
00202 
00203     # If there was an error in sourcing any of the selected plugins, report the error to the user
00204     if {[llength $bad_sources] > 0} {
00205       set names [list]
00206       foreach bad_source $bad_sources {
00207         set registry($bad_source,selected) 0
00208         lappend names $registry($bad_source,name)
00209       }
00210       tk_messageBox -default ok -type ok -icon warning -parent . -title [msgcat::mc "Plugin Errors"] \
00211         -message [msgcat::mc "Syntax errors found in selected plugins"] -detail [join $names \n]
00212     }
00213 
00214   }
00215 
00216   ######################################################################
00217   # Handles an error when sourcing a plugin file.
00218   proc handle_status_error {index status} {
00219 
00220     variable registry
00221 
00222     # Save the status
00223     set registry($index,status) $status
00224 
00225     # If we are doing development, send the full error info to standard output
00226     if {[::tke_development]} {
00227       puts $::errorInfo
00228     }
00229 
00230     # Set the current information message
00231     gui::set_info_message "ERROR: [lindex [split $status \n] 0]"
00232 
00233   }
00234 
00235   ######################################################################
00236   # Called when a plugin is sourced.  Checks to see if the plugin wants
00237   # to be called to save data when it is resourced (data will otherwise
00238   # be lost once the plugin has been resourced.
00239   proc handle_resourcing {index} {
00240 
00241     variable registry
00242     variable prev_sourced
00243 
00244     set name $registry($index,name)
00245 
00246     if {$registry($index,selected) && [info exists prev_sourced($name)]} {
00247       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval [lindex $prev_sourced($name) 0] $index" status]} {
00248         handle_status_error $index $status
00249       }
00250     }
00251 
00252   }
00253 
00254   ######################################################################
00255   # Called when a plugin is sourced.  If the plugin retrieves saved information,
00256   # allows the plugin to do it.
00257   proc handle_reloading {index} {
00258 
00259     variable registry
00260     variable prev_sourced
00261 
00262     set name $registry($index,name)
00263 
00264     if {$registry($index,selected) && [info exists prev_sourced($name)]} {
00265       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval [lindex $prev_sourced($name) 1] $index" status]} {
00266         handle_status_error $index $status
00267       }
00268     }
00269 
00270   }
00271 
00272   ######################################################################
00273   # Allows a plugin to save temporary data to non-corruptible memory.
00274   # This memory will be cleared whenever the plugin retrieves the data.
00275   proc save_data {index name value} {
00276 
00277     variable temp_user_data
00278 
00279     set temp_user_data($index,$name) $value
00280 
00281   }
00282 
00283   ######################################################################
00284   # If a previous call to save_data form the same index/name combination
00285   # was called, returns the value stored for that variable.  Removes
00286   # temporary memory prior to returning.
00287   proc restore_data {index name} {
00288 
00289     variable temp_user_data
00290 
00291     if {[info exists temp_user_data($index,$name)]} {
00292       set value $temp_user_data($index,$name)
00293       unset temp_user_data($index,$name)
00294     } else {
00295       set value ""
00296     }
00297 
00298     return $value
00299 
00300   }
00301 
00302   ######################################################################
00303   # Installs available plugins.
00304   proc install {} {
00305 
00306     variable registry
00307     variable registry_size
00308 
00309     # Add registries to launcher
00310     for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00311       if {!$registry($i,selected)} {
00312         set name $registry($i,name)
00313         launcher::register_temp "`PLUGIN:$name" "plugins::install_item $i" $name 0 "plugins::show_detail $i"
00314       }
00315     }
00316 
00317     # Display the launcher in PLUGIN: mode
00318     launcher::launch "`PLUGIN:" 1
00319 
00320   }
00321 
00322   ######################################################################
00323   # Installs the plugin in the registry specified by name.
00324   proc install_item {index} {
00325 
00326     variable registry
00327 
00328     # Delete all plugin menu items
00329     delete_all_menus
00330 
00331     # Delete all plugin text bindings
00332     delete_all_text_bindings
00333 
00334     # Source the file if it hasn't been previously sourced
00335     if {$registry($index,interp) eq ""} {
00336       if {$registry($index,treqd) && !$registry($index,tgntd)} {
00337         set answer [tk_dialog .installwin "Plugin Trust Requested" \
00338           "The $registry($index,name) plugin requires permission to view/modify your system.  Grant permission?" \
00339           "" "Grant" "Reject" "Grant" "Always grant from developer"]
00340         switch $answer {
00341           "Grant"  { set registry($index,tgntd) 1 }
00342           "Reject" { set registry($index,tgntd) 0 }
00343           default  {
00344             set registry($index,tgntd) 1
00345           }
00346         }
00347       }
00348       set interpreter [interpreter::create $registry($index,name) $registry($index,tgntd)]
00349       if {[catch "uplevel #0 [list interp eval $interpreter source $registry($index,file)]" status]} {
00350         handle_status_error $index $status
00351         set registry($index,selected) 0
00352         interpreter::destroy $registry($index,name)
00353       } else {
00354         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Plugin %s installed" $registry($index,name)]
00355         set registry($index,selected) 1
00356         set registry($index,interp)   $interpreter
00357         handle_reloading $index
00358         run_on_start_after_install $index
00359       }
00360 
00361     # Otherwise, just mark the plugin as being selected
00362     } else {
00363       gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Plugin %s installed" $registry($index,name)]
00364       set registry($index,selected) 1
00365       run_on_start_after_install $index
00366     }
00367 
00368     # Add all of the plugins
00369     add_all_menus
00370 
00371     # Add all of the text bindings
00372     add_all_text_bindings
00373 
00374   }
00375 
00376   ######################################################################
00377   # This procedure is called in the install_item procedure and causes any
00378   # on_start actions associated with the plugin to be called when the plugin
00379   # is installed.
00380   proc run_on_start_after_install {index} {
00381 
00382     variable registry
00383 
00384     # If the given event contains an "on_uninstall" action, run it.
00385     foreach {name action} [array get registry $index,action,on_start,*] {
00386       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval {*}$action" status]} {
00387         handle_status_error $index $status
00388       }
00389     }
00390 
00391   }
00392 
00393   ######################################################################
00394   # Uninstalls previously installed plugins.
00395   proc uninstall {} {
00396 
00397     variable registry
00398     variable registry_size
00399 
00400     for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00401       if {$registry($i,selected)} {
00402         set name $registry($i,name)
00403         launcher::register_temp "`PLUGIN:$name" "plugins::uninstall_item $i" $name
00404       }
00405     }
00406 
00407     # Display the launcher in PLUGIN: mode
00408     launcher::launch "`PLUGIN:"
00409 
00410   }
00411 
00412   ######################################################################
00413   # Uninstalls the specified plugin.
00414   proc uninstall_item {index} {
00415 
00416     variable registry
00417 
00418     # Call "on_uninstall" command, if it exists
00419     handle_on_uninstall $index
00420 
00421     # Delete all plugin menu items
00422     delete_all_menus
00423 
00424     # Delete all text bindings
00425     delete_all_text_bindings
00426 
00427     # Destroy the interpreter
00428     interpreter::destroy $registry($index,name)
00429 
00430     # Unselect the plugin
00431     set registry($index,selected) 0
00432     set registry($index,interp)   ""
00433 
00434     # Add all of the plugins
00435     add_all_menus
00436 
00437     # Add all of the text bindings
00438     add_all_text_bindings
00439 
00440     # Display the uninstall message
00441     gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Plugin %s uninstalled" $registry($index,name)]
00442 
00443   }

00445   ######################################################################
00446   # Displays plugin information into the given text widget.
00447   proc show_detail {index txt} {
00448 
00449     variable registry
00450 
00451     $txt tag configure bold -underline 1
00452 
00453     $txt insert end "Version:\n\n" bold
00454     $txt insert end "$registry($index,version)\n\n\n"
00455     $txt insert end "Description:\n\n" bold
00456     $txt insert end $registry($index,description)
00457 
00458   }

00460   ######################################################################
00461   # Creates a new plugin
00462   proc create_new_plugin {} {
00463 
00464     set name ""
00465 
00466     if {[gui::user_response_get [msgcat::mc "Enter plugin name"] name]} {
00467 
00468       if {![regexp {^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$} $name]} {
00469         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Plugin name is not valid (only alphanumeric and underscores are allowed)"]
00470         return
00471       }
00472 
00473       set dirname [file join $::tke_dir plugins $name]
00474 
00475       if {[file exists $dirname]} {
00476         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Plugin name already exists"]
00477         return
00478       }
00479 
00480       # Create the plugin directory
00481       if {[catch { file mkdir $dirname }]} {
00482         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Unable to create plugin directory"]
00483         return
00484       }
00485 
00486       # Create the filenames
00487       set header [file join $dirname header.tkedat]
00488       set main   [file join $dirname main.tcl]
00489 
00490       # Create the main file
00491       if {[catch { open $main w } rc]} {
00492         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Unable to write plugin files"]
00493         return
00494       }
00495 
00496       # Create the main file
00497       puts $rc "# Plugin namespace"
00498       puts $rc "namespace eval $name {"
00499       puts $rc ""
00500       puts $rc "  # INSERT CODE HERE"
00501       puts $rc ""
00502       puts $rc "}"
00503       puts $rc ""
00504       puts $rc "# Register all plugin actions"
00505       puts $rc "api::register $name {"
00506       puts $rc ""
00507       puts $rc "}"
00508       close $rc
00509 
00510       # Add the new file to the editor
00511       gui::add_file end $main -savecommand plugins::reload
00512 
00513       # Create the header file
00514       if {[catch { open $header w } rc]} {
00515         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Unable to write plugin files"]
00516         return
00517       }
00518 
00519       # Create the header file
00520       puts $rc "name           {$name}"
00521       puts $rc "author         {}"
00522       puts $rc "email          {}"
00523       puts $rc "version        {1.0}"
00524       puts $rc "include        {yes}"
00525       puts $rc "trust_required {no}"
00526       puts $rc "description    {}"
00527       close $rc
00528 
00529       # Add the file to the editor
00530       gui::add_file end $header -savecommand plugins::reload
00531 
00532     }
00533 
00534   }
00535 
00536   ######################################################################
00537   # Finds all of the registry entries that match the given action.
00538   proc find_registry_entries {type} {
00539 
00540     variable registry
00541 
00542     set plugin_list [list]
00543     foreach action [lsort -dictionary [array names registry *,action,$type,*]] {
00544       lassign [split $action ,] index
00545       if {$registry($index,selected)} {
00546         lappend plugin_list [concat $index $registry($action)]
00547       }
00548     }
00549 
00550     return $plugin_list
00551 
00552   }
00553 
00554   ######################################################################
00555   # Adds the menus to the given plugin menu.  This is called after the
00556   # plugin menu is initially created.
00557   proc menu_add {mnu action} {
00558 
00559     # Get the list of menu entries
00560     if {[llength [set entries [find_registry_entries $action]]] > 0} {
00561       $mnu add separator
00562     }
00563 
00564     # Add each of the entries
00565     foreach entry $entries {
00566       lassign $entry index type hier do state
00567       menu_add_item $index $mnu $action [split $hier /] $type $do $state
00568     }
00569 
00570   }
00571 
00572   ######################################################################
00573   # Adds menu item, creating all needed cascading menus.
00574   proc menu_add_item {index mnu action hier type do state} {
00575 
00576     variable registry
00577 
00578     # If the type is a separator, we need to run the while loop one more time
00579     set force [expr {[lindex $type 0] eq "separator"}]
00580 
00581     # Add cascading menus
00582     while {([set hier_len [llength [set hier [lassign $hier level]]]] > 0) || $force} {
00583       set sub_mnu [string tolower [string map {{ } _} $level]]
00584       if {![winfo exists $mnu.$sub_mnu]} {
00585         set new_mnu [menu $mnu.$sub_mnu -tearoff 0 -postcommand "plugins::menu_state $mnu.$sub_mnu $action"]
00586         $registry($index,interp) alias $new_mnu interpreter::widget_win $registry($index,name) $new_mnu
00587         $mnu add cascade -label $level -menu $mnu.$sub_mnu
00588       }
00589       set mnu $mnu.$sub_mnu
00590       if {$hier_len == 0} {
00591         set force 0
00592       }
00593     }
00594 
00595     # Handle the state
00596     if {$state ne ""} {
00597       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval $state" status]} {
00598         handle_status_error $index $status
00599         set state "disabled"
00600       } elseif {$status} {
00601         set state "normal"
00602       } else {
00603         set state "disabled"
00604       }
00605     }
00606 
00607     # Add menu item
00608     switch [lindex $type 0] {
00609       command {
00610         $mnu add command -label $level -command [list $registry($index,interp) eval {*}$do] -state $state
00611       }
00612       checkbutton {
00613         $mnu add checkbutton -label $level -variable [lindex $type 1] \
00614           -command [list $registry($index,interp) eval {*}$do] -state $state
00615       }
00616       radiobutton {
00617         $mnu add radiobutton -label $level -variable [lindex $type 1] \
00618           -value [lindex $type 2] -command [list $registry($index,interp) eval {*}$do] -state $state
00619       }
00620       cascade {
00621         set new_mnu_name "$mnu.[string tolower [string map {{ } _} $level]]"
00622         set new_mnu [menu $new_mnu_name -tearoff 0 -postcommand "plugins::post_cascade_menu $index $do $new_mnu_name"]
00623         $registry($index,interp) alias $new_mnu interpreter::widget_win $registry($index,name) $new_mnu
00624         $mnu add cascade -label $level -menu $new_mnu
00625       }
00626       separator {
00627         $mnu add separator
00628       }
00629     }
00630 
00631   }
00632 
00633   ######################################################################
00634   # Handles a cascade menu post command.
00635   proc post_cascade_menu {index do mnu} {
00636 
00637     variable registry
00638 
00639     # Recursively delete all of the items in the given menu
00640     menu_delete_cascade $mnu
00641 
00642     # Call the plugins do command to populate the menu
00643     if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval $do $mnu" status]} {
00644       handle_status_error $index $status
00645     }
00646 
00647   }
00648 
00649   ######################################################################
00650   # Recursively deletes all submenus of the given menu.
00651   proc menu_delete_cascade {mnu} {
00652 
00653     # If the menu is empty, stop now
00654     if {[$mnu index end] ne "none"} {
00655 
00656       # Recursively remove the children menus
00657       for {set i 0} {$i <= [$mnu index end]} {incr i} {
00658         if {[$mnu type $i] eq "cascade"} {
00659           menu_delete_cascade [set child_menu [$mnu entrycget $i -menu]]
00660           destroy $child_menu
00661         }
00662       }
00663 
00664       # Delete all of the menu items
00665       $mnu delete 0 end
00666 
00667     }
00668 
00669   }
00670 
00671   ######################################################################
00672   # Deletes all of the menus in the plugins menu.
00673   proc menu_delete {mnu action} {
00674 
00675     variable menus
00676 
00677     # Get the list of menu entries
00678     if {[llength [set entries [find_registry_entries $action]]] > 0} {
00679 
00680       # Delete all of the plugin items
00681       foreach entry $entries {
00682         lassign $entry index type hier
00683         set hier [split [string tolower [string map {{ } _} $hier]] /]
00684         if {$type ne "cascade"} {
00685           set hier [lrange $hier 0 end-1]
00686         }
00687         if {[menu_delete_item $mnu $hier]} {
00688           $mnu delete last
00689         }
00690       }
00691 
00692       # Delete the last separator
00693       $mnu delete last
00694 
00695     }
00696 
00697   }
00698 
00699   ######################################################################
00700   # Deletes one upper level
00701   proc menu_delete_item {mnu hier} {
00702 
00703     while {[llength $hier] > 0} {
00704       if {![winfo exists $mnu.[join $hier .]]} {
00705         return 0
00706       }
00707       catch { destroy $mnu.[join $hier .] }
00708       set hier [lrange $hier 0 end-1]
00709     }
00710 
00711     return 1
00712 
00713   }
00714 
00715   ######################################################################
00716   # Updates the plugin menu state of the given menu.
00717   proc menu_state {mnu action} {
00718 
00719     variable registry
00720     variable menus
00721 
00722     foreach entry [find_registry_entries $action] {
00723       lassign $entry index type hier do state
00724       set entry_mnu $menus($action)
00725       if {[llength [set hier_list [split $hier .]]] > 1} {
00726         append entry_mnu ".[string tolower [string map {{ } _} [join [lrange $hier_list 0 end-1] .]]]"
00727       }
00728       if {$mnu eq $entry_mnu} {
00729         if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval $state" status]} {
00730           handle_status_error $index $status
00731         } elseif {$status} {
00732           $mnu entryconfigure [lindex $hier_list end] -state normal
00733         } else {
00734           $mnu entryconfigure [lindex $hier_list end] -state disabled
00735         }
00736       }
00737     }
00738 
00739   }
00740 
00741   ######################################################################
00742   # Adds all of the plugins to the list of available menus.
00743   proc add_all_menus {} {
00744 
00745     variable menus
00746 
00747     foreach {action mnu} [array get menus] {
00748       menu_add $mnu $action
00749     }
00750 
00751   }
00752 
00753   ######################################################################
00754   # Adds all of the text bindings to all open text widgets.
00755   proc add_all_text_bindings {} {
00756 
00757     foreach txt [gui::get_all_texts] {
00758       handle_text_bindings $txt
00759     }
00760 
00761   }
00762 
00763   ######################################################################
00764   # Deletes all plugins from their respective menus.
00765   proc delete_all_menus {} {
00766 
00767     variable menus
00768 
00769     foreach {action mnu} [array get menus] {
00770       menu_delete $mnu $action
00771     }
00772 
00773   }
00774 
00775   ######################################################################
00776   # Deletes all text bindings that were previously created.
00777   proc delete_all_text_bindings {} {
00778 
00779     variable bound_tags
00780 
00781     foreach {bt txts} [array get bound_tags] {
00782       foreach txt $txts {
00783         if {[set index [lsearch -exact [set btags [bindtags $txt]] $bt]] != -1} {
00784           bindtags $txt [lreplace $btags $index $index]
00785         }
00786         if {[set index [lsearch -exact [set btags [bindtags $txt.t]] $bt]] != -1} {
00787           bindtags $txt.t [lreplace $btags $index $index]
00788         }
00789       }
00790     }
00791 
00792     # Delete all of the bound tags
00793     array unset bound_tags
00794 
00795   }
00796 
00797   ######################################################################
00798   # Called when the plugin menu is created.
00799   proc handle_plugin_menu {mnu} {
00800 
00801     variable menus
00802 
00803     # Add the menu to the list of menus to update
00804     set menus(menu) $mnu
00805 
00806     # Add the menu items
00807     menu_add $mnu menu
00808 
00809   }

00858   ######################################################################
00859   # Creates a bindtag on behalf of the user for the given text widget
00860   # and calls the associated procedure to have the bindings added.
00861   proc handle_text_bindings {txt} {
00862 
00863     variable registry
00864     variable bound_tags
00865 
00866     set ctags       [bindtags $txt]
00867     set cpre_index  [expr [lsearch -exact $ctags $txt] + 1]
00868     set cpost_index [lsearch -exact $ctags .]
00869 
00870     set ttags       [bindtags $txt.t]
00871     set tpre_index  [expr [lsearch -exact $ttags $txt.t] + 1]
00872     set tpost_index [lsearch -exact $ttags .]
00873 
00874     foreach entry [find_registry_entries "text_binding"] {
00875       lassign $entry index type name cmd
00876       set bt "plugin__$registry($index,name)__$name"
00877       bindtags $txt   [linsert $ctags [expr {($type eq "pretext") ? $cpre_index : $cpost_index}] $bt]
00878       bindtags $txt.t [linsert $ttags [expr {($type eq "pretext") ? $tpre_index : $tpost_index}] $bt]
00879       $registry($index,interp) alias $txt $txt
00880       $registry($index,interp) alias $txt.t $txt.t
00881       interpreter::add_ctext $registry($index,name) $txt
00882       if {![info exists bound_tags($bt)]} {
00883         if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval $cmd $bt" status]} {
00884           handle_status_error $index $status
00885         }
00886         set bound_tags($bt) $txt
00887       } else {
00888         lappend bound_tags($bt) $txt
00889       }
00890     }
00891 
00892   }
00893 
00894   ######################################################################
00895   # Generically handles the given event.
00896   proc handle_event {event args} {
00897 
00898     variable registry
00899 
00900     foreach entry [find_registry_entries $event] {
00901       if {[catch "$registry([lindex $entry 0],interp) eval [lindex $entry 1] $args" status]} {
00902         handle_status_error [lindex $entry 0] $status
00903       }
00904     }
00905 
00906   }
00907 
00908   ######################################################################
00909   # Called whenever the application is started.
00910   proc handle_on_start {} {
00911 
00912     # Handle an application start
00913     handle_event "on_start"
00914 
00915   }

00949   ######################################################################
00950   # Called when the application is exiting.
00951   proc handle_on_quit {} {
00952 
00953     # Handle the on_quit event
00954     handle_event "on_quit"
00955 
00956     # Finally, write the plugin information file
00957     write_config
00958 
00959   }
00960 
00961   ######################################################################
00962   # Called when a plugin is uninstalled.
00963   proc handle_on_uninstall {index} {
00964 
00965     variable registry
00966 
00967     # If the given event contains an "on_uninstall" action, run it.
00968     foreach {name action} [array get registry $index,action,on_uninstall,*] {
00969       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval {*}$action" status]} {
00970         handle_status_error $index $status
00971       }
00972     }
00973 
00974   }
00975
